title: Cannot install client / update client
body:
that is the logs for the failed installation im pretty sure. keeps failing to update i've reinstalled changed location of the installation got rid of Microsoft visual programs. nothing is helping

Starting
--------
> Getting LoL install path... Failed
  - C:\Program Files (x86)\lol.launcher.exe
> Getting LoL install path... Failed
  - C:\Program Files (x86)\lol.launcher.admin.exe
> Getting LoL install path... Failed
  - C:\Program Files (x86)\lol.launcher.exe
> Getting LoL install path... Failed
  - Operation canceled by user
> Getting user profile... Done
  - C:\Users\user
> Creating the "LoL Logs" folder... Done

Running ping test
-----------------
Pinging www.google.com [172.217.2.164] with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 172.217.2.164: bytes=32 time=76ms TTL=52
Reply from 172.217.2.164: bytes=32 time=16ms TTL=52
Reply from 172.217.2.164: bytes=32 time=22ms TTL=52
Reply from 172.217.2.164: bytes=32 time=45ms TTL=52

    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 16ms, Maximum = 76ms, Average = 39ms

> Saving results to file... Done

Syncing system clock
--------------------
> Starting Time Sync Service... Failed
  /!\ Error: You will need to re-run with admin priviledges
> Resyncing clock... The following error occurred: The service has not been started. (0x80070426)

--------------

-------------------------------------

Flushing DNS... Done

  /!\ Error: No install path provided

replies.body:
The logs don't tell me too much, but I did notice the part that is asking you to re-run with admin privileges.  If you can offer me some more context like error messages you're receiving I can get a better idea, but based on this it sounds like your settings are blocking installation.  Firstly, you should redownload[ visual c++](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387) because it's a necessary windows product and needed to install.

Once you've got that back, run through the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to add League as an exception.  That should do it!
